name: John Smith
past_history: Hypertension, Type 2 Diabetes, Previous MI in 2019
nurse_note: Patient stable, compliant with medications. Blood pressure slightly elevated.

doctor_notes.note: Patient presents with chest discomfort. EKG shows no acute changes. Continue current medications and schedule follow-up in 2 weeks.
Routine follow-up for hypertension management. BP well controlled on current regimen. Advised dietary modifications.
Initial consultation for chest pain evaluation. Ordered stress test and echocardiogram. Patient educated on cardiac risk factors.

name: Maria Garcia
past_history: No significant medical history. Previous normal delivery in 2020.
nurse_note: Patient doing well postpartum. Vital signs stable. Breastfeeding successfully.

doctor_notes.note: Postpartum day 2. Patient recovering well from vaginal delivery. No complications noted. Discharge planned for tomorrow.
Admitted in active labor. Normal vaginal delivery of healthy baby boy at 39 weeks gestation. No complications during delivery.

name: Robert Johnson
past_history: Osteoarthritis, Previous hip replacement surgery in 2018, Mild COPD
nurse_note: Post-operative day 1 after knee replacement. Pain managed with medication. Encouraging mobility.

doctor_notes.note: Post-op day 1 total knee replacement. Surgical site clean and dry. Patient tolerating physical therapy well. Continue current pain management protocol.
Successful total knee replacement surgery completed. No intraoperative complications. Patient stable in recovery.
Pre-operative consultation for total knee replacement. Patient cleared for surgery. Discussed risks and benefits.

name: Lisa Chen
nurse_note: Patient presented with acute asthma exacerbation. Responded well to nebulizer treatments. Symptoms improving.

doctor_notes.note: Patient presented with acute asthma exacerbation triggered by upper respiratory infection. Treated with albuterol nebulizers and oral steroids. Symptoms improved significantly. Discharge with inhaler and steroid course.

name: David Brown
past_history: GERD, Previous peptic ulcer disease, Family history of colon cancer
nurse_note: Patient stable post-colonoscopy. No immediate complications. Clear liquids tolerated well.

doctor_notes.note: Screening colonoscopy completed successfully. Two small polyps removed and sent for pathology. Recommend repeat colonoscopy in 3 years unless pathology indicates otherwise.
Pre-procedure consultation for screening colonoscopy. Patient counseled on procedure and prep instructions provided.
